intro: Viscum rigidum, commonly known as the common mistletoe, is a parasitic plant that grows on the branches of various trees. It belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white or yellowish berries. The plant derives its nutrients from its host through specialized structures called haustoria. It is often found in temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa. Viscum rigidum plays a role in local ecosystems and has been used in traditional medicine and rituals.
